ai.summary: A demanding 20.1 km circuit-style hike called Manchester Green Trail 14 in the UK. The route combines long distances with varied terrain and notable elevation changes, making it best suited for experienced hikers seeking a rigorous day's trek.
ai.terrain_summary: Mixed terrain: forest trails, grassy uplands, rocky tracks, and occasional urban-style sections. Expect muddy footpaths after rain, uneven ground, and some exposed stretches that may require careful footing.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for a long day on a hard route. Bring a map and compass or reliable GPS, as some sections may have limited phone reception. Check local weather and daylight hours; UK weather can change quickly. Start early to ensure enough daylight, stay hydrated, and carry enough food and emergency supplies. Hike with a companion if possible, and know your personal limits.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good ankle support
Water bottle or hydration system (2–3 L)
Layered clothing and a waterproof jacket
Headwear and gloves for cold or windy conditions
Map and compass (or offline GPS) and a fully charged phone
Snack-rich foods and a light thermos
Small first aid kit and emergency whistle
Headlamp or flashlight with extra batteries
Light emergency shelter or space blanket (optional but recommended for long routes)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn; winter hiking is possible with proper gear and careful planning.

seo.title: Manchester Green Trail 14 – 20.1 km Hard Hike in the UK
